en.gameInfo4: Answer as many correctly as possible in 120s to travel further! Use the calculator if necessary.
en.ques3:
Triangle of Sides 
 8, 15 , 17 -YES -WRONG ANSWER!
 8²(64)+15²(225) is 289, which is equal to 17²(289).
en.gameInfo3:
Tap right side of the screen if they form a right angled triangle.
Tap the left side of the screen if they don't form a right angled triangle.
en.screen04_desc: The above mentioned values form right triangles. 6²+8²=10² 12²+16²=20² 15²+20²=25²
en.fin_desc:
FIN!

 Thank you for learning with us! 
Music by Eric Matyas 
www.soundimage.org
 Sound effects obtained from https://www.zapsplat.com
en.ques19:
Triangle of Sides 
 8, 15 , 17 -YES -WRONG ANSWER!
 8²(64)+15²(225) is 289, which is equal to 17²(289).
en.ques8:
Triangle of Sides 
 14, 16 , 20 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
  14²(196)+16²(256) is 452, which is not equal to 20²(400).
en.ques17:
Triangle of Sides 
 9, 13 , 14 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 9²(81)+13²(169) is 250, which is not equal to 14²(196).
en.gameInfo5: Careful! Three wrong answers will end the game.
en.ques5:
Triangle of Sides 
 12, 16 , 20 -YES -WRONG ANSWER!
 12²(144)+16²(256) is 400, which is equal to 20²(400).
en.ques11:
Triangle of Sides 
 3, 3 , 5 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 3²(9)+3²(9) is 18, which is not equal to 5²(25).
en.ques7:
Triangle of Sides 
 12, 14 , 17 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 12²(144)+14²(196) is 340, which is not equal to 17²(289).
en.main_menu_tag: A game about the Pythagorean theorem
en.screen4_desc: The area of the BLUE square on the left equals the sum of the areas of the two BLUE squares on the right. That's what Pythagorean theorem states!
en.ques1:
Triangle of Sides 
 3, 4, 5 -YES -WRONG ANSWER!
 3²(9)+4²(16) is 25, which is equal to 5²(25).
en.ques6:
Triangle of Sides 
 6, 8 , 10 -YES -WRONG ANSWER!
 6²(36)+8²(64) is 100, which is equal to 10²(100).
en.ques18:
Triangle of Sides 
 15, 20 , 25 -YES -WRONG ANSWER!
 15²(225)+20²(400) is 625, which is equal to 25²(625).
en.ques14:
Triangle of Sides 
 9, 12 , 13 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 9²(81)+12²(144) is 225, which is not equal to 13²(16).
en.screen03_desc:
The converse of the Pythagorean theorem is used to determine if a triangle is a right triangle. It uses the relationship between the lengths of the legs and hypotenuse to prove a right angle.
Look at the above values. What do you notice?
en.ques20:
Triangle of Sides 
 10, 24 , 26 -YES -WRONG ANSWER!
 10²(100)+24²(576) is 676, which is equal to 26²(676).
en.ques13:
Triangle of Sides 
 6, 10 , 12 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 6²(36)+10²(100) is 136, which is not equal to 12²(144).
en.ques4:
Triangle of Sides 
 5, 10 , 13 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 5²(25)+10²(100) is 125, which is not equal to 13²(169).
en.ques12:
Triangle of Sides 
 9, 12 , 15 -YES -WRONG ANSWER!
 9²(81)+12²(144) is 225, which is equal to 15²(225).
en.screen1_desc: Pythagorean Theorem can be proved in various ways. We shall cover a simple one today that uses re-arrangement.
en.ques2:
Triangle of Sides 
 8, 12 ,15 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 8²(64)+12²(144) is 208, which is not equal to 15²(225).
en.ques10:
Triangle of Sides 
 6, 11 , 12 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 6²(36)+11²(121) is 157, which is not equal to 12²(144).
en.screen01_desc: The Pythagorean Theorem applies to all right triangles and states that the square of the hypotenuse (longest side opposite the right angle) is equal to the sum of the square of the other two sides. a²+b²=c²
en.ques9:
Triangle of Sides 
 15, 18 , 20 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 15²(225)+18²(324) is 549, which is not equal to 20²(400).
en.ques15:
Triangle of Sides 
 10, 13 , 14 -NO -WRONG ANSWER!
 10²(100)+13²(169) is 269, which is not equal to 14²(196).
en.ques16:
Triangle of Sides 
 5, 12 , 13 -YES -WRONG ANSWER!
 5²(25)+12²(144) is 169, which is equal to 13²(169).
en.screen02_desc: Let's check this for a right triangle with sides of lengths 3, 4, and 5.
en.gameInfo2:
Help the Neon Ship travel as far as possible.
You will be presented with the values for sides of a triangle. You have to check if they form
a right angled triangle.
en.screen2_desc: Let's look at the above arrangement of triangles of sides a, b, and c.
